DD_Attribute.name: latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude of the sub-spacecraft point in Mean Earth frame.

DD_Attribute.name: longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude of the sub-spacecraft point in Mean Earth frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude of the sub-spacecraft point in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude of the sub-spacecraft point in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame.

DD_Attribute.name: altitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft altitude above the lunar reference sphere (radius=1737.4 km) in km

DD_Attribute.name: altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: Spacecraft altitude above the lunar surface in km

DD_Attribute.name: activity_number
DD_Attribute.definition:
Activities are the main units of data collection for UVS. They correspond to a single instrument power cycle so spectra collected within a single activity are relatively near each other in both space and time. Also, the spacecraft was generally oriented during an activity for a single observational purpose.
Activities are numbered based on an incrementing counter that named UVS data files as they were created onboard the spacecraft. Most activities generated a single file, so activity numbers are approximately a count of the number of instrument power cycles. Occultation activities are the exception because they generated enough spectra to span two data files. Occultation activities, therefore, are assigned the number given to their first file, and no activity is assigned the number given to the second file, i.e., activity numbering skips one number after each occultation.

DD_Attribute.name: activity_type
DD_Attribute.definition: A short string describing the nature of each activity.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Backward limb observation with instrument nod
Forward limb observation with instrument nod
North limb observation with instrument nod
South limb observation with instrument nod
Backward limb observation without instrument nod
Forward limb observation without instrument nod
North limb observation without instrument nod
South limb observation without instrument nod

DD_Attribute.name: average_counts
DD_Attribute.definition: Average of all pixel values (range 0-1043) in DNs or calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The number of cosmic ray hits identified within the spectrum.

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_00
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_01
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_02
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_03
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_04
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_05
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_06
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_07
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_08
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_09
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_10
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_11
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_12
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_13
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_14
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_15
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: cosmic_ray_hit_pixel_16
DD_Attribute.definition: 16 bits of a 1044-bit vector giving the location of hits

DD_Attribute.name: drive_current
DD_Attribute.definition: Thermo-Electric Cooler (TEC) Drive current in mA

DD_Attribute.name: emission_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the surface normal and the vector to LADEE in degrees. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

DD_Attribute.name: in_sun
DD_Attribute.definition: An integer representing three bits. Each bit represents a geometric calculation asking whether the upper limb of the sun is above the lunar limb (including terrain) at (bit 0) the spectrum’s timestamp, (bit 1) 1 second before the start of data collection, and (bit 2) 1 second after the end of data collection. The 1 second buffers were chosen to be slightly conservative. A value of 0 means ‘definitely in shadow’ and 7 means ‘definitely in sun’. Intermediate reflect intermediate knowledge.

DD_Attribute.name: integration_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The detector integration time for each scan, in milliseconds.

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_vx
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_vy
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_vz
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the spacecraft velocity in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km/s

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

DD_Attribute.name: moon_fixed_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the spacecraft position in rectangular coordinates in Mean Earth frame and in km

DD_Attribute.name: peak_counts
DD_Attribute.definition: Maximum value in the spectrum, either in DNs or in calibrated units

DD_Attribute.name: phase_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the sun vector and the vector to LADEE, in degrees. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

DD_Attribute.name: quaternion_w
DD_Attribute.definition: W component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

DD_Attribute.name: quaternion_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

DD_Attribute.name: quaternion_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

DD_Attribute.name: quaternion_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z component of the spacecraft attitude quaternion in J2000 frame, estimated on-board by flight software. w is the scalar term.

DD_Attribute.name: raw_timestamp
DD_Attribute.definition: Uncorrected timestamp applied by the s/c relative to the J2000 epoch in units of subseconds (2^-16 sec). This timestamp was applied to each spectrum as soon as it had been fully received by flight software from the UVS instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: saturated_pixel_count
DD_Attribute.definition: Number of pixels above a threshold value. Currently 60000 counts.

DD_Attribute.name: scan_number
DD_Attribute.definition: A sequence number assigned to each spectrum by the instrument. This number starts at 0 every time the instrument is commanded to capture a stream of spectra with the same integration time and spacing in time. During some activities, the integration time, spacing or both were changed, causing this number to be reset one or more times.

DD_Attribute.name: sequence_number
DD_Attribute.definition: A sequence number assigned to each spectrum within an activity. This number does not reset within an activity, so the activity_number, sequence_number pair forms a unique identifier for each spectrum just as each spectrum’s timestamp is unique.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_incidence_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: If the UVS telescope boresight intersects the lunar reference sphereoid, this is the angle at the intersection between the sun vector and surface normal. 0 otherwise. Calculated by SPICE ilumin_c().

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_j2000_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in J2000 frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_boresight_me_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the normalized solar-viewer boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_fov_graze_altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: The circular edge of the solar viewer field-of-view corresponds to a cone rooted at the spacecraft. This value is the closest approach of that cone to terrain in km, or 0 if the cone intersects.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_altitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The closest approach of the solar-viewer boresight vector to the lunar reference sphere, or 0 if it intersects

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: The closest approach of the solar-viewer boresight vector to terrain in km, or 0 if it intersects

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the solar viewer boresight vector and the LRO lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the solar viewer boresight vector and the LRO lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_solar_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the solar occultation viewer boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_graze_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the solar occultation viewer boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_solar_elongation
DD_Attribute.definition: Angle between the solar viewer boresight and the sun vector, in degrees

DD_Attribute.name: solar_viewer_target
DD_Attribute.definition: A short string describing what is in the solar viewer’s field-of-view.

DD_Attribute.name: sun_graze_altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: The circular limb of the sun corresponds to a cone rooted at the spacecraft. This value is the closest approach of that cone to terrain in km, or 0 if the cone intersects terrain.

DD_Attribute.name: tec_cold
DD_Attribute.definition: Thermo-electric cooler cold-side temperature, which is the best estimate of the temperature of the detector, in degrees centigrade

DD_Attribute.name: tec_enabled
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates whether the Thermo-electric cooler is active.

DD_Attribute.name: tec_hot
DD_Attribute.definition: Thermo-electric cooler hot-side temperature, in degrees centigrade

DD_Attribute.name: tec_setpoint
DD_Attribute.definition: The target temperature, in degrees C, to which the UVS’ thermo-electric cooler has been configured to drive the detector temperature.

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_j2000_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_j2000_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_j2000_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular J2000 frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_me_x
DD_Attribute.definition: X coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_me_y
DD_Attribute.definition: Y coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_boresight_me_z
DD_Attribute.definition: Z coordinate of the normalized telescope boresight vector in rectangular Mean Earth frame

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_earth_elongation
DD_Attribute.definition: Angle between the telescope boresight vector and the Earth vector, in degrees

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_ecliptic_declination
DD_Attribute.definition: Angle between the telescope boresight vector and the plane of the ecliptic

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_fov_graze_altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: Altitude above terrain in km of the vector through the edge of the telescope field of view closest to the moon center or 0 if the vector intersects terrain

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_altitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Altitude above the reference sphere in km of the telescope boresight vector or 0 if the vector intersects the reference sphere

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_altitude_above_terrain
DD_Attribute.definition: Altitude above terrain in km of the telescope boresight vector or 0 if the vector intersects terrain

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude in Mean Earth frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_solar_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_graze_solar_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude in a selenocentric, sun-synchronous frame of the intersection of the telescope boresight vector and the lunar reference sphere or the closest point on the reference sphere to that vector.

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_solar_elongation
DD_Attribute.definition: Angle between the telescope boresight and the sun vector in degrees

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_sun_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: Azimuth in degrees of the sun vector in UVS telescope frame. This is approximately the angle between the Telescope boresight and the sun vector projected onto the LADEE radiator panel

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_sun_elevation
DD_Attribute.definition: Elevation in degrees of the sun vector in UVS telescope frame. This is approximately the angle between the sun vector and the LADEE radiator on which UVS is mounted

DD_Attribute.name: telescope_target
DD_Attribute.definition: A short string describing what is in the telescope’s field-of-view.

DD_Attribute.name: uvs_timestamp
DD_Attribute.definition: A timestamp applied to the spectrum by the UVS instrument, in msec since UVS’ firmware booted. This provides a way to measure relative time that is independent of the spacecraft clock. It is not synchronized with that clock, and it starts at 0 during every UVS activity.

DD_Attribute.name: valid_checksum
DD_Attribute.definition: True if the packet received by the spacecraft from UVS contained one spectrum with a valid checksum, False otherwise.

DD_Attribute.name: predicted_attitude_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: 0 indicates spacecraft attitude estimated onboard by flight software was used to generate the metadata for this spectrum. 1 indicates that the attitude commanded by ground controllers was used. Onboard estimated attitudes were used for all spectra except when they were unavailable.

DD_Class.name: UVS_Specific_Attributes
DD_Class.definition: The UVS Specific Attributes class provides local attributes used by UVS observations.

DD_Class.name: LADEE
DD_Class.definition: This is the umbrella class for the LADEE mission dictionary.
